featured.text: He and Mestre Pastinha were the first to open schools, and the Capoeira tree grew, spreading its branches across the world.
Capoeira is also believed to have influenced several dancing styles like breaking and hip-hop.

However, a man known as Mestre Bimba devoted a great deal of time and effort to convincing the Brazilian authorities that Capoeira has great cultural value and should become an official fighting style.
At first, Capoeira was considered illegal in Brazil.
In the sixteenth century, when the Africans were taken from their homes to Brazil against their will and kept in slavery, Capoeira began to take form among the community of slaves for self-defense.

other.text: When the slave owners realized the power of Capoeira, they began to punish those who practiced it.
Which of the following will probably NOT be found in the performance of Capoeira? (A) Singing with drums.
According to the passage, which of the following statements is true about Capoeira? (A) It was greatly influenced by modern dancing styles.
What is the author’s attitude toward Capoeira as a sport? (A) Admiring.

definition.zh_def: 一種源自巴西的武術，結合舞蹈、音樂和體操元素。
definition.en_def: A Brazilian martial art that combines elements of dance, music, and acrobatics.
definition.example: He practices capoeira every weekend to improve his agility and rhythm.
